intro: Eriosema psoraleoides, commonly known as the hairy eriosema, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom during the warmer months. Its leaves are covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive, fuzzy appearance. Eriosema psoraleoides is often found in open grasslands and rocky outcrops, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
